alert.note: Alert for Boone (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 11:28PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Boone County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1127 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Petersburg, or 13 miles north of Albion, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Boone County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern Nebraska.
